thread.title: Metra train hits pedestrian west of Roselle station
thread.title_full: Metra train hits pedestrian west of Roselle station

author: Chicago Tribune staff
title: Metra train hits pedestrian west of Roselle station
text:
Metra train hits pedestrian west of Roselle station Metra commuter rail Tribune Illustration Tribune Illustration Chicago Tribune staff Milwaukee District-West Line train hit a pedestrian just west of the commuter railroad's Roselle station Monday evening, a spokeswoman for the agency said.
Train No. 2239 had been scheduled to leave the Roselle station, headed for Elgin , just before 6:10 p.m., and the incident happened not far to the west of the station, said Katie Dahlstrom, a Metra spokeswoman. 
Metra police are investigating the incident, but Dahlstrom did not immediately have information on the circumstances. Roselle police referred questions to Metra police. 
Trains in both directions on the line were stopped in the area of the station, and delays were expected to last a hour to 90 minutes, Dahlstrom said. Check Metra's website for travel details . 
Check back for updates.
